item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Source: Eli Manning, New York Giants agree to six-year, $97.5 million contract extension
item.description: Eli Manning has agreed to a new six-year, $97 million contract extension with the New York Giants that will make him the highest-paid player in the NFL with an average salary of roughly $15.3 million.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Prince Fielder of Milwaukee Brewers tries to charge Los Angeles Dodgers clubhouse after beaning
item.description: Not even Prince Fielder really knows what he might have done if a phalanx of security guards and teammates hadn't prevented the furious Milwaukee slugger from entering the Los Angeles clubhouse after a ninth-inning beaning.

item.dc:creator: Kelly Naqi
item.title: Donte' Stallworth of Cleveland Browns to meet with Roger Goodell, source says
item.description: Browns wide receiver Donte' Stallworth, currently under indefinite suspension by the NFL, will meet with commissioner Roger Goodell on Wednesday afternoon in Manhattan, according to a source with knowledge of the meeting.

item.dc:creator: James Walker
item.title: Braylon Edwards, of Cleveland Browns, practices for first time
item.description: Cleveland Browns receiver Braylon Edwards practiced for the first time in training camp Wednesday after the team took him off the Non-Football Injury List.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Reggie Bush leaves New Orleans Saints practice with knee issue
item.description: Reggie Bush has had a setback with his surgically repaired left knee. Bush left Saints practice on Wednesday morning and later returned with his knee wrapped in ice.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Maurice Clarett withdraws request for early release from prison
item.description: Former Ohio State football star Maurice Clarett has withdrawn a request for early release from prison that he said would allow him to pursue an NFL career.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Philadelphia Eagles' Juqua Parker charged with marijuana possession
item.description: Philadelphia Eagles defensive end Juqua Parker has been arrested on a marijuana possession charge in northeast Pennsylvania.

item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.title: Jesse Owens' 4-gold performance to be honored in Berlin
item.description: One of the most memorable moments in athletic history will be recalled at the Berlin world championships when the granddaughter of American Jesse Owens and the son of German Luz Long present medals in the Olympic stadium.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Hank Aaron wants 2003 list of failed tests revealed
item.description: Hank Aaron wants the names on the 2003 list of players who flunked drug tests to be released and thinks Pete Rose should be reinstated.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Report: Brandon Roy, Portland Trail Blazers close to long-term contract
item.description: Brandon Roy and the Blazers are reportedly nearing agreement on a long-term extension.
